title: Chancellor Changes Tax Plans
summary: The chancellor, who is a government leader in charge of money, was thinking about making people pay more income tax. Income tax is money that workers give to the government from their pay. But now, the chancellor has decided not to do this. This is important because it was a promise made during elections. Breaking a promise can make people unhappy. The decision helps workers keep more of their money. It shows how leaders make choices that affect everyone. This news helps us understand how governments work and why they change their minds.

background_read: The chancellor is a key person in the government who decides how to collect and spend money. Income tax is a fee that people pay based on how much they earn from jobs. A manifesto is a document where political parties list their goals and promises before elections. When leaders consider changing taxes, it can affect how much money families have. This article talks about a decision to keep a promise, which is important for trust in government.
Article_Structure: WHO: The chancellor, a government leader
WHAT: Decided not to raise income tax rates
WHERE: In the government budget planning
WHY: To keep a manifesto promise and avoid breaking it

People might be relieved to not pay more taxes.
